meanings.sent1: The apocryphalness of the story made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: The apocryphalness of the ancient text raised doubts about its accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphalness of the rumor led to confusion among the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: Her smile held an apocryphalness that hinted at hidden sadness.
meanings.sent5: The apocryphalness of the legend added a sense of mystery to the tale.

meanings.definition: The state of being of doubtful authenticity.
meanings.sent1: His expression showed a hint of apocryphalness, making me question his sincerity.
meanings.sent2: The apocryphalness of the signature cast doubt on the document's validity.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphalness of the excuse made everyone raise their eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The painting's apocryphalness left art experts puzzled about its origins.
meanings.sent5: The apocryphalness of the claim left room for skepticism among the audience.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being of questionable origin.
meanings.sent1: The apocryphalness of the artifact made historians curious about its history.
meanings.sent2: The apocryphalness of the story added an element of intrigue to the narrative.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphalness of the product's label made consumers hesitant to purchase it.
meanings.sent4: The apocryphalness of the discovery sparked debates among scientists.
meanings.sent5: The apocryphalness of the tradition made it difficult to trace its roots.
